title: Carbon: The Element of Life
description: A short lesson to help you apply Carbon: The Element of Life.

hook.text: Carbon forms more compounds than all other elements combined. It's the king of chemistry.

buildup.text: Carbon can bond with four other atoms at once, creating chains, rings, and branches.

discovery.text: This versatility builds every protein, fat, carbohydrate, and DNA molecule in your body.

climax.text: Same element, different arrangement. Diamond and pencil lead are both pure carbon.

punchline.text: Diamonds and pencil lead are the same element. Arrangement is everything.

quiz.question: Why can carbon form so many different compounds?
options: It can bond with four atoms simultaneously
